file_content.text: Cipher! I'm sorry to interrupt, but I believe I have a solution for both you and Doctor Cel.
I'm listening.
Let me speak to the scientist, please.
You want to explain where you heard that name?
How do you know about Cel?
Yes, well. I was hoping you wouldn't ask that.
We can discuss this later, doctor.
Now's a bad time. [Disconnect]
You disconnected me. I'm disappointed.
Who is this?
Doctor Eckard Lokin. I'm going to be your assistant, and be captured in your place.
Are you joking?
I wouldn't joke about this, doctor--I saw your lecture on xenometamorphic epidemiology, and a mind like yours should be kept safe.
Imagine: Ki Sazen takes me instead of her, and brings me to the Ultrawave Transmitter. I signal you, and you find everything you want in one place.
Doctor Eckard Lokin. I saw your lecture on xenometamorphic epidemiology.
I understand your misgivings. "How did he track me here?" "How did he survive the ruins unscathed?" Both reasonable questions.
But like you, I'm a resourceful person, and we do share a common goal. We're all friends of the Republic here--right, Doctor Cel?
You're starting to make me wonder. That's not good for your prospects.
I have my doubts.
We can discuss our "common interests" another time. Make your pitch.
We'll talk about this later.
Thank you. Doctor Cel, I'd like you to tell the Republic that I'm your assistant.
Same goal or not... a blaster to the head solves my problem.
Maybe I should just kill you.
Paranoia can be healthy, but it doesn't get you closer to the Jedi. Only Doctor Cel can do that--by revealing that I am her assistant.
You've got to be kidding.
I know rakghoul science well enough to convince Ki Sazen that I'm an adequate substitute for Cel. I'll be taken to the Ultrawave Transmitter.
Once captive, I signal you, and you find Ki Sazen and the transmitter. And rescue me, of course.
Would Ki Sazen believe this man is your assistant?
Your opinion, Doctor Cel?
What's the difference between a Hirano strain of the rakghoul virus and the Bozan variant?
Aside from the phenotypic switching controversy?
Mutation of the Clawdite-derived gene sequence.
She'll believe him.
It's not a bad plan. We might even survive it.
That might work.
If you deviate from the plan, you won't get out alive.
You'll obey my orders.
I'm a humble scientist. I'll follow you every step of the way.
Understood.
Doctor, please contact the authorities on an unsecured channel. Tell them your assistant is at these coordinates, and must be found.
Doctor, please contact the authorities on an unsecured channel. Tell them your assistant is at Dynamet General, and must be found.
It's your life on the line. Just be careful--both of you.
One final concern--once I'm captured, the Republic may attempt jam my signal to you.
I suggest you use this time to sabotage their jamming stations. By the time you're done, I'll surely be in enemy hands.
One last thing, while I wait to be captured. There is a chance the Republic will jam my signal to you.
Before you come for Ki Sazen, you'll have to sabotage their jamming stations. They're guarded by wilderness troopers--a good warm-up for fighting a Jedi Knight.
Doctor Ianna Cel? I'm with the SIS. Password: "gemstone." You agreed to meet with us.
Don't move. Just... hell, I barely know how to fire one of these things.
You have no idea how glad I am to see you--I've been hiding from that Jedi for weeks.
What do you know about Ki Sazen, and why she's after you?
Tell me about the Jedi.
Have you been holed up in here this whole time?
How did you survive?
Mostly. I've been living off ration bars and some kind of edible hospital gel that even the rakghouls won't touch.
If you don't make this worth my while, I can still let her have you.
You'd better cooperate.
Let me show you something. I kept it with me as evidence.
Doctor Cel. You haven't returned my calls. That's disappointing.
The Jedi have plans for the rakghouls, but I can't move forward without your support.
Turn yourself over to the Nikto, or I'll make my case to you in person.
She's not a Jedi. She already killed Doctor Vernon and Professor Vraal when they couldn't fix some transmitter. I'm the last rakghoul expert on Taris.
She needs you to complete a device for controlling rakghouls.
The Ultrawave Transmitter.
Of course she does. She's completely crazy...
Can you tell me where she is?
I need to find her.
No, and if I stick my head out, she'll see me.
If you really are the last, then it's over. The Ultrawave Transmitter is a dead project.
She can't win without you.
Assuming she doesn't find another way. And if she's halfway there...
If that's yours, I can wait.
What is it?
Keep your voice down. It's not safe in here.
